subject: RE: [junit] Re: JUnit vs Regression Testing
msgSnippet: Hi Anand, ... No, sorry, you are right. I should have started brain before writing.  ... Both are regression tests, but JUnis is a unit test (white box),
messageBody:
Hi Anand,

>Thanks for your response.
>But by executing these test-suites repeatedly am I not exactly
>performing a Regression Test ? I ensure that the old code is not
>broken and at the same time I test the new modifications also.
>Kindly correct if I am wrong.

No, sorry, you are right. I should have started brain before writing. <g>

>Even JUnit is described as a Regession Testing framework and I had
>some posts earlier in this group which confirmed that.

Both are regression tests, but JUnis is a unit test (white box), while your
description indicates functional tests (black box). I know tools like
Mercury LoadRunner quite good enough to know their value, but they have a
different approach. Each testing method has its own place, JUnit is used by
programmers ensuring that they implement the necessary "software contract"
and ensures that this contract is not suddenly broken, while recording the
output of an application and comparing different runs is a much higher
testing level.

Greetings,
Jorg
